learning_paths.name: Complete Foundations Track
learning_paths.description: Comprehensive introduction to the theoretical foundations of Active Inference and the Free Energy Principle

learning_outcomes: Understand theoretical foundations of Active Inference
Apply mathematical concepts to practical problems
Implement basic Active Inference models
Critically evaluate research in the field

learning_paths.name: Information Theory Basics
learning_paths.description: Essential information theory concepts for understanding Active Inference

learning_outcomes: Calculate entropy for probability distributions
Understand KL divergence as distribution distance
Apply mutual information to measure dependence

learning_paths.name: Bayesian Fundamentals
learning_paths.description: Core concepts of Bayesian probability and inference

learning_outcomes: Apply Bayes' theorem to real problems
Design Bayesian probabilistic models
Implement belief updating algorithms

learning_paths.name: Free Energy Principle Theory
learning_paths.description: Deep dive into the theoretical foundations of the Free Energy Principle

learning_outcomes: Derive free energy expressions mathematically
Apply FEP to biological systems
Connect FEP to other theoretical frameworks

learning_paths.name: Active Inference Framework
learning_paths.description: Complete Active Inference framework from theory to implementation

learning_outcomes: Design Active Inference agents
Implement policy selection mechanisms
Apply Active Inference to real problems

learning_paths.name: Advanced Mathematics Track
learning_paths.description: Rigorous mathematical treatment of Active Inference concepts for advanced learners

metadata.prerequisites: strong background in calculus, linear algebra, probability theory
learning_outcomes: Derive key mathematical results in Active Inference
Understand geometric interpretations of probability
Analyze convergence properties of algorithms
Connect Active Inference to other mathematical frameworks

learning_paths.name: Practical Implementation Track
learning_paths.description: Hands-on implementation of Active Inference algorithms and systems

learning_outcomes: Implement Active Inference agents from scratch
Build variational inference algorithms
Create policy selection systems
Debug and optimize Active Inference code

learning_paths.name: Applications Track
learning_paths.description: Real-world applications of Active Inference across different domains

learning_outcomes: Apply Active Inference to specific problem domains
Design generative models for real applications
Understand domain-specific constraints and requirements
Evaluate Active Inference solutions in practice

learning_paths.name: Complete Active Inference Curriculum
learning_paths.description: Comprehensive learning path covering all aspects of Active Inference from theory to practice

learning_outcomes: Master complete Active Inference framework
Understand theoretical foundations and practical applications
Implement and deploy Active Inference systems
Conduct research in Active Inference
Teach and communicate Active Inference concepts

learning_paths.name: Quick Start Guide
learning_paths.description: Fast introduction to Active Inference for immediate understanding

learning_outcomes: Understand what Active Inference is
Grasp the basic principles and framework
See how it can be implemented
Identify potential applications
